section.title: Building the Website
section.p: The website is produced with Apache Forrest. It allows you to build a reasonably good looking website without a whole lot of work. There's no need to develop your own menu and template system. You provide the content and it draws the interface around it.

This site is currently built with Forrest version 0.5.1. Please read the Forrest website for installation instructions. After installing Forrest you need to get the website project. This is available from the same cvs repository that the main source code is, it's just a different module, www. Check this out, go into that directory, and type forrest. This should produce a copy of the website in the build/site subdirectory.
There are a couple of pieces of the website that are not built with Forrest, notably the Javadoc API documentation and the downloads. These are produced from the source code itself.

section.title: Adding a Page
section.p: To add a page the easiest thing to do is copy an existing one from src/documentation/content/xdocs and ripping out its content. Then you need to add the new file to the menu system listed in site.xml. A good place to look for examples is Forrest's own site and the source it comes from, their subversion repository.
